Mr. Jack M. Burke
Office of Extension Radio and Television
Kansas State University
Manhattan, Kansas 66502
Dear Mr. Burke:
I am sorry I was unable to see you during your recent trip to
Washington as the official representative for the National
Educational Radio Association, but I am pleased to know you talked
with Charles Grady, a member of my staff.
He tells me your organization would appreciate having an opportunity
to tell of the potential of educational radio before committee hearings
on the ETV Facilities Act. He also tells me that you will send me an
extensive research report on educational radio prior to the hearings.
As we study ways to improve our total education program, I shall
certainly want to be informed on both radio and television and how
these two great facilities might be coordinated in future educat onal
innovations .
With kindest regards and best wishes, I am
Sincerely,
